intro: Hibbertia villosa, commonly known as the woolly sunburst, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers with red centers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. Hibbertia villosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant and striking blooms.
